title: The Trouble with Exotic Pets
description: Imagine going to a friend's house to see his or her new pet, but it's not a dog; it's a tiger! Tigers are one example of exotic pets that are owned by people throughout the world. The Trouble with Exotic Pets introduces readers to the pros and cons of owning exotic pets. The simple text and detailed photographs will keep students engaged in this controversial topic. This book can also be used to teach students the skill of distinguishing between fact and opinion as well as asking and answering questions to better understand the text.
